data.title: Wonderful selection!
data.text: We enjoy shopping and eating at Vallarta. The tamales are wonderful. The meats are all Mexican cuts and the vegetables are fresh and well displayed. If you love Mexican food you'll find everything you need here.

data.title: Pretty Awesome Sumermarket with Food Bar
data.text: Came here to buy some "Mexican" groceries. I was surprised to see they had a food bar and store made fresh tortillas. They have tons of dffernt fresh and marinated meats, salsa bar, fresh food bar. Got some tomalles,  a  bag of tortillas (still warm) and some marinated chicken and beef to make Carne Asada, and some salsa and Mexican creama among other things. Everything was Fresh and tasted AWESOME (after we cooked it). The tomalles although good has to much masa (thick) for my taste. We need a place like this on the East Coast.

data.title: Traveling on Highway 101? STOP HERE
data.text: Hungry travelers, we got off to find eats at about 10:15 am on a Tuesday. Saw this market and stopped, hoping they had a small deli for a quick bite, WOWZA! a full food bar with everything fresh, hot, Mexican style. A neat full juice bar too. Tables to sit at, and the young lady spoke English so we could communicate.  Yummy! There is also a huge fresh ceviche bar for a to-go. Amazing array of fresh and prepared foods so I think anyone on the road could be happy to stop here.

data.title: Viva Vallarta!
data.text: When we went in to the Vallarta it was so clean! the cake section on the right and there were people in line to buy roasted chicken and Carnitas! We bought a Birthday Cake and some short ribs this trip. All in all a great experience!

data.title: It's like dining in Mexico, but the food's safe and you can drink the water!
data.text: The ambience inside Vallarta Market is like being in a U.S. grocery store, but Mexican music is played, the meat and produce prices are quite low, and the informal restaurant is very good, with quite low prices. It's interesting to people watch while listening to Mexican music while you dine. Quite an informal setup: order and pay at the counter, although you can see many of the foods, displayed cafeteria-style...but some foods are cooked to order.And, the fresh-squeezed vegetable and fruit juices are terrific!
